decks.notes: The main idea of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Doomsday deck is to efficiently utilize cards like Doomsday, Brainstorm, Ponder, and various tutors to set up a win condition with Thassa's Oracle. The deck aims to quickly draw through the library, set up the perfect pile with Doomsday, and win the game by winning the game on the spot. The deck utilizes various card draw, counter spells, and tutoring effects to ensure a fast and consistent combo finish.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and controlling the board. By utilizing efficient spells and disruptive counters, along with powerful card draw like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and gradually grind them out of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and innovative creatures like Psychic Frog contribute to the deck's ability to control the game and dictate the pace of play.

This deck aims to dominate the game through control elements, using cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes powerful cards such as Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Black Lotus to generate card advantage and accelerate the game. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing for the recursion of key permanents. By efficiently managing resources and countering key threats, this Esper Control deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells and disruptive plays while utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play. It includes cards like Show and Tell and Flash to quickly put threats into play, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck also features additional disruption with cards like Vexing Bauble and Gaea's Blessing to disrupt opponents' strategies. The goal is to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through powerful creatures and control elements.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through efficient removal and countermagic. The inclusion of powerful mana accelerators such as the Moxen and Black Lotus allows for casting spells ahead of curve, while cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den provide additional value. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and force the opponent into unfavorable positions, ultimately grinding out a win through attrition and card advantage.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland, Strip Mine, and Sphere of Resistance, while deploying powerful threat creatures like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, Patchwork Automaton, and Stonecoil Serpent. Crucible of Worlds allows for recurring land destruction, and artifacts like Moxen and Sol Ring provide fast mana acceleration. Null Rod shuts down opposing artifact strategies, and cards like Mystic Forge and Trinisphere provide additional control and disruption. Overall, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats while disrupting their game plan through mana denial and artifact hate.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly generate mana and use it to play powerful artifacts that disrupt the opponent's game plan and apply pressure with aggressive creatures. This deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere while also having ways to untap artifacts like Grim Monolith and Time Vault to generate more value. Additionally, cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Mystic Forge provide card advantage and additional threats to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Underworld Breach to recur spells from the graveyard and generate a powerful advantage. It includes various spells like Demonic Tutor, Brainstorm, and Treasure Cruise to dig for combo pieces and disrupt opponents. Additionally, it features powerful cards like Force of Will and Ancestral Recall to control the game and protect the combo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck's strategy, making it a formidable force in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Oath of Druids as a powerful control mechanism, allowing the player to quickly bring out high-powered creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes strong counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its strategy, along with tools like Show and Tell to cheat out big threats. Additionally, the deck features various mana accelerants and card draw spells to ensure consistency and efficiency in executing its game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Coveted Jewel combo using powerful artifacts like Mishra's Workshop, Paradoxical Outcome, and Grim Monolith. By generating mana quickly and controlling the board with Force of Will and other disruptive spells, the deck aims to deploy the Coveted Jewel and use it to generate card advantage and potentially win the game in a single explosive turn. Additional cards like Tinker, Mana Vault, and Mystic Forge help accelerate the combo and provide redundancy in case the primary win condition is disrupted.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifacts and spells to generate a large amount of mana, draw cards, and eventually win the game through a combo with Paradoxical Outcome. By casting multiple cheap artifacts, spells like Paradoxical Outcome can be used to return them to hand while drawing more cards and generating more mana. The deck also includes powerful disruption spells like Force of Will and Chain of Vapor to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's gameplan. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful mana generation.

The deck aims to control the game using counterspells and removal while generating card advantage with draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise. The deck also utilizes cards like Null Rod and Nihil Spellbomb to disrupt the opponent's strategies. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting its own threats, like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog. The deck seeks to out-value the opponent by efficiently using its resources and making optimal plays to come out on top in a battle of attrition.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature threats paired with disruptive hate cards to disrupt opponents' strategies. By combining creatures with taxing effects and powerful enchantments, the deck aims to slow down opponents while applying pressure to end the game quickly. The mana acceleration provided by artifacts like Chrome Mox and the powerful lands enables the deck to play its threats ahead of schedule, overwhelming opponents before they can stabilize. The deck's strategy revolves around disrupting opponents' game plan while aggressively pushing towards victory with efficient creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and card draw to generate mana and card advantage to quickly assemble a game-winning combo using cards like Paradoxical Outcome. By casting cheap spells and generating extra mana from artifacts, the deck aims to continuously draw through the deck, eventually finding the pieces needed to win the game. Cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Stock Up help fuel the combo, while cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares provide protection and answers to opponent's threats. Overall, the deck aims to combo off quickly and efficiently to secure the win.

This deck focuses on control and resource denial, with a particular emphasis on disruption and card advantage. It includes a blend of powerful spells and efficient creatures to control the game and out-value the opponent. By utilizing counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating advantage through card selection and recursion. The inclusion of powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk further enhances the deck's ability to gain an advantage and control the game.

The main focus of this deck is to abuse the graveyard mechanics and quickly fill the graveyard with key cards like Ichorid, Golgari Thug, and Stinkweed Imp to generate a massive amount of value through recurring creatures and triggering effects like Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad to dig for combo pieces and Serum Powder to ensure a strong opening hand. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation help protect the combo from disruption.
